definition: to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband

sentences.english: There will still be times when we scowl and growl.
sentences.chinese: 我们做父母的有时还是会连吼带叫的。

sentences.english: You can hear the sergeant bellowing at the rookies.
sentences.chinese: 你可以听到士官长对着菜鸟们大吼。

sentences.english: Brown has been yelling at me all day.
sentences.chinese: 他今天一整天对谁都是又吼又叫的。

sentences.english: Man red eye, a roar , I want to know why not hit you?
sentences.chinese: 男人红了眼，一声吼，想知道我为啥不打你吗？

sentences.english: Yo ho, haul together, hoist the Colors high.
sentences.chinese: 唷吼，一起转航，扬起船旗。

sentences.english: His shouting was frightening and the boys felt frightened.
sentences.chinese: 他大吼一声把那些男孩都吓住了。

sentences.english: He head butted me in gratitude for not yelling at him.
sentences.chinese: 它用头蹭着我对我没有对它大吼表示感谢。

sentences.english: The captain's voice blared in the tube.
The cannon vomited forth its package of buck -shot with a roar. But there was no rebound.
sentences.chinese: 大炮一声吼，喷出了一丛霰弹，但没有弹跳的情况。

sentences.english: If you bark at someone in public it won't make the relationship any better.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在公共场合吼了谁，那对关系缓和可没有好处。

sentences.english: The dog barks whenever he sees a stranger. But his bark is worse than his bite.
sentences.chinese: 这只狗见到陌生人就叫，但它光吼不咬人。

sentences.english: Zhang Jie virtually crazily of roar noisy, that voice but be full of unwilling.
sentences.chinese: 张杰近乎疯狂的大吼出来，那声音却充满了不甘。

sentences.english: The cannon vomited forth its package of buck-shot with a roar. But there was no rebound.
sentences.chinese: 大炮一声吼，喷出了一丛霰弹，但没有弹跳的情况。

sentences.english: Hoo,I heard that the famous Jianguodaye is being shot day and night.
sentences.chinese: 吼，我听说建国大业正在日以继夜地拍呢。

definition: to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
